notesStmt.note: Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (fl. 1600-1624): inscribed with his name, 1607 (folio 183r); see 100-101, and appendix § 80-84.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 23 quires of mostly 8 leaves each. Catchwords at the end of the quires, mostly cut away.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi (French) square and semi-cursive script, partially punctuated, of the 13th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Machzor Vitry. Vol. I. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,200.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 314: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153.
